programme.title: Neticamā planēta Zeme
programme.desc: Tici vai ne, bet uz mūsu planētas ir daudz ļoti neparastu dabas parādību! Kā rodas luminiscējoši, elektriski zili viļņi, kas skalojas krastā? Kādēļ zemes virsmu klāj noslēpumaini apļi, kas sniedzas, cik tālu vien acs spēj saskatīt? Dažām no šīm brīnumainajām parādībām var rast izskaidrojumu, bet citas pārsteidz pat vispieredzējušākos zinātniekus. Dodies ceļojumā pa plašo planētu, lai atklātu, cik dīvaina un neizdibināma ir mūsu pasaule!

programme.title: Neticamā planēta Zeme
programme.desc: Tici vai ne, bet uz mūsu planētas ir daudz ļoti neparastu dabas parādību! Kā rodas luminiscējoši, elektriski zili viļņi, kas skalojas krastā? programme.title: NHL 2024/25. Vancouver Canucks - New York Rangers
Zebra. Zebra Yr 9 (2025) Ep. 911
programme.desc: Raidījuma vadmotīvs ir nemainīgs – drošība un ātrums! Tēmu loks tāpat – satiksmes drošība, satiksmes organizācija un iespējamie risinājumi. Transportlīdzekļu vadītājiem un gājējiem saistošu likumu un noteikumu izmaiņas, Eiropas valstu pieredze satiksmes problēmu risināšanā. Sava daļa stāstu būs atvēlēta sportiem, kas saistīti ar ātrumu. Raidījums visiem, kas ceļā! Raidījuma vadītājs – Pauls Timrots.

programme.title: Vindrivera
programme.desc: Sniegotā līdzenumā indiāņu rezervātā “Vindrivera” pēddzinis un mednieks Korijs Lamberts atrod jaunas sievietes līķi. Kad autopsijā atklājas, ka sieviete tikusi izvarota, vietējais šerifs lūdz FIB palīdzību. Lai izmeklētu notikušo, no Lasvegasas uz indiāņu rezervātu tiek nosūtīta FIB aģente Džeina Benere. Drīz atklājas, ka viņa ieradusies nesagatavota – gan skarbajam apvidum, gan gaidāmajai cīņai par patiesību un izdzīvošanu.

programme.title: Pārkāpt robežu 3
programme.desc: Volters Vaits ir ķīmijas skolotājs. Viņam jau ir dēls invalīds un sieva gaida vēl vienu bērnu. Skolotāja alga ir maza, tādēļ Volters piestrādā automazgātavā, kur skolnieki labprāt izmanto iespēju gan par viņu, gan slimo dēlu paņirgāties. Voltera svainis savukārt strādā Narkotiku apkarošanas nodaļā un reiz Volteram piedāvā iespēju piedalīties operācijā kādā metamfetamīna laboratorijā. Operācijas laikā Volts redz, kā viens dīleris aizbēg, un tas izrādās viņa bijušais skolnieks. Volts nolemj sākt nodarboties ar narkotiku ražošanu, jo zaudēt vairs nav ko – dakteris ir paziņojis, ka viņam ir plaušu vēzis. Volts kopā ar jauno pārinieku noīrē treileri, kuru pārtaisa par laboratoriju un nogādā tuksneša vidū. Var jau būt, ka šis bizness ir ienesīgs, bet tas prasa stiprus nervus...

programme.title: Mītu grāvēji: lūk, tava problēma!
programme.desc: Trieciendrošās brilles uz acīm, ugunsdzēšamais aparāts gatavībā – laiks eksperimentiem mītu grāvēju stilā! Pieredzes bagātie specefektu meistari Ādams Sevidžs un Džeimijs Hainemans desmit gadu garumā testējuši, vai Holivudas radītie mīti un urbānās leģendas iet roku rokā ar fizikas likumiem. Īpaši jaudīgākie, iespaidīgākie un pārsteidzošākie eksperimenti no Mītu grāvēju kolekcijas nu apkopoti unikālās un jautrās tematiskajās sērijās. Šajā triecienu, sprādzienu un blīkšķu enciklopēdijā atradīsies gan tādas tēmas kā ūdens, gāze, gravitācija, gan enerģija un spiediens.

programme.title: Kā vilcieni mainīja pasauli
programme.desc: Kas kopīgs Mikipelei, Harijam Poteram un Slepkavībai Austrumu ekspresī? Tās visas bija idejas, kas dzima vilcienos! Dodies atklājumu pilnā ceļojumā cauri visiem kontinentiem, jo katrā no tiem ir savi unikālie stāsti par “dzelzs zirgu”. Vai zināji, ka Āfrikā reiz bija iecerēta dzelzceļa līnija no Keiptaunas uz Kairu? Tas bija vērienīgs projekts, ko uzsāka Britu impērija, lai nostiprinātu kontroli pār kontinentu, taču tā arī neīstenojās. Savukārt Amerikā savulaik tapuši neparasti inženierijas varoņdarbi, ierīkojot dzelzceļu pāri un cauri Klinšu kalniem. Bet Indijā koloniālā dzelzceļa būvniecības programma ir pamats tam, kas šobrīd ir ceturtais lielākais dzelzceļa tīkls un astotais lielākais darba devējs pasaulē, kas ik dienu pārvadā vairāk nekā 22 miljonus pasažieru. Ielūkojies aizraujošajā industriālā laikmeta vēsturē un atklāj, kā vilcieni ir ietekmējuši pasaules attīstību.

programme.title: Krimināli smieklīgi
programme.desc: Noziedznieki mēdz būt neģēlīgi, zemiski, baisi, nekrietni un arī... krimināli smieklīgi. Šī ir tava iespēja savām acīm skatīt dažus no nejēdzīgākajiem, dīvainākajiem un idiotiskākajiem noziedzniekiem, ko šī planēta var piedāvāt. Videonovērošanas kadri un ar telefonu uzņemti aculiecinieku video, kas liks nosarkt likumpārkāpēja vietā. No zagļiem, ko aizraida vecas, sirmas kundzītes, līdz caur griestiem krītošiem laupītājiem – skaties un uzjautrinies!

programme.title: Mini pa trim 2
programme.desc: Attapības spēle ģimenei un draugiem, kuru vada aktieris Mārtiņš Počs. Spēle norisināsies “Draudzīgajā kafejnīcā”, kur vairākās kārtās tiek meklētas pareizās atbildes uz dažādiem jautājumiem. Spēle norisinās, sacenšoties trim komandām, kurās apvienojušās sabiedrībā pazīstamas personas ar ģimeni vai draugiem!

programme.title: Gāzi grīdā: no A līdz Z. TOP GEAR: FROM A-Z Ep: 2
programme.desc: Raidījums divās daļās, kurš atskatās uz visiem Gāzi grīdā gadiem, kuros kopā strādājusi leģendārā trijotne – Klārksons, Hemonds un Mejs.

programme.title: Simpsoni 11
programme.desc: Savas pastāvēšanas laikā seriāls vairākkārt ieguvis prestižas godalgas, tai skaitā jau 18 “Emmy” balvas. Homēra mīļākais teiciens “D’oh!” ir kļuvis par popkultūras ikonu un 2001.gadā iekļauts Oksfordas vārdnīcā. 2003.gada 16.februārī seriāla 300.sērijas “dzimšanas dienā” Simpsoni tika pie savas zvaigznes Holivudas Slavas alejā!

programme.title: Krietnie zagļi 2
programme.desc: Kādreiz Neitans Fords bija apdrošināšanas firmas izmeklētājs. Tagad viņš saaicinājis komandā vislabākos bijušos noziedzniekus. Viņi palīdz tiem cilvēkiem, kuri nevēlas vai nespēj atrisināt savas problēmas ar likumīgām metodēm un policijas palīdzību. Parasti tas nozīmē, ka viņiem ir jāapkrāpj blēži, kas iedzīvojušies uz sveša īpašuma rēķina un bieži vien pat skaitās sabiedrībā cienījami ļaudis. Neita komandā ietilpst datorģēnijs un hakeris Aleks Hārdisons, zagle un trakulīga dāma Pārkere, aktrise un krāpniece Sofija un plaša profila speciālists Eliots. Šie ļaudis ir retums, īstas pērles – zagļu komanda, par kuru godīgie tur īkšķi, lai viņiem izdodas!

programme.title: Antikvariāts uz riteņiem
programme.desc: Antīko lietu pārzinātāja Kristīna Trevainjona un amatnieks Vils Kērks apceļo Lielbritānijas mājsaimniecības, noslauka putekļus no tur atrastām, nenovērtētām pērlēm un atklāj to stāstus. Daudz nevilcinoties, šie dārgumu mednieki ķeras pie relikviju rūpīgas atjaunošanas un, kad lietas atguvušas agrāko spozmi, ļauj tām nonākt pareizajās rokās, dodot jaunu dzīvi.

programme.title: Antikvariāts uz riteņiem
programme.desc: Antīko lietu pārzinātāja Kristīna Trevainjona un amatnieks Vils Kērks apceļo Lielbritānijas mājsaimniecības, noslauka putekļus no tur atrastām, nenovērtētām pērlēm un atklāj to stāstus. Daudz nevilcinoties, šie dārgumu mednieki ķeras pie relikviju rūpīgas atjaunošanas un, kad lietas atguvušas agrāko spozmi, ļauj tām nonākt pareizajās rokās, dodot jaunu dzīvi.

programme.title: No zēna par vīru 2
programme.desc: Ceļotājs Tims Nūnans dodas episkā piedzīvojumā uz pasaules skarbākajām vietām, lai savām acīm ieraudzītu dažus no pasaules sīkstākajiem vīriem. Dokumentālajās sērijās atklājas piedzīvojumu meklētāja divus gadus ilgais ceļojums uz nomaļiem pasaules nostūriem Brazīlijā, Kamerūnā, Kirgizstānā, Madagaskarā, Meksikā, Mongolijā, Jaungvinejā, Krievijā, Taizemē un Venecuēlā. Tur viņš iepazina maz pētītu cilšu kultūru, pamazām iemantoja iezemiešu uzticību un visbeidzot – piedzīvoja bīstamākos pilngadības rituālus un pārbaudījumus, kādi saglabājušies līdz mūsdienām.

programme.title: Pasaules spēkavīru čempionāts 2024
programme.desc: Pasaules spēkavīru sacensības pārbauda stiprinieku absolūtās robežas, metot izaicinājumu ne tikai viņu fiziskajam spēkam, bet arī veiklībai un garīgajai izturībai. Starp dalībniekiem arī Latvijas spēkavīrs Aivars Šmaukstelis, kuram pieder vairāki Ginesa rekordi.

programme.title: Nakts muzejā: kapenes noslēpums
programme.desc: Kad eksponāti Ņujorkas Dabas vēstures muzejā sāk uzvesties visai dīvaini, Lerijam Deilijam, kurš tagad vada nakts maiņu, ir jānoskaidro šo dīvainību cēlonis. Viņš uzzina, ka plāksne, kas brīnumainā kārtā atdzīvina Tediju Rūzveltu, Džededaiju un pārējos eksponātus, ir sākusi apsūbēt. Lerijam kopā ar dēlu un draugiem no muzeja ir jādodas uz Britu muzeju Londonā, lai uzzinātu, kā novērst plāksnes maģijas izzušanu.

programme.title: Basketbols: NBA 2024/25. Cleveland Cavaliers - Utah Jazz
Pēdējā deja
programme.desc: Reti, vēl neredzēti kadri atklās līdz šim neizstāstīto stāstu par visu laiku slavenākā basketbolista Maikla Džordana pēdējo gadu Čikāgas "Bulls" sastāvā 1997.–1998. gada NBA sezonā.

programme.title: Women Under Hitlers Flag
programme.sub-title: Women were far from mere witnesses or accomplices by 1942 - and played a role as important as it was deadly. After the war, the women of the Reich simply slipped through the judicial net.
programme.desc: Many German women were active participants in the Nazi regime, some proving to be as ruthless as their better-known male counterparts; why did post-war justice turn a blind eye to their crimes?

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: The scars of centuries of conflict are etched into Italys ancient landmarks; this episode explores how it rose from the devastating failure of fascism to the rebirth of its identity.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: Bomber: Terror of WWII
programme.sub-title: The ﬁrebombing of Tokyo signalled the power of the B29 bomber, the development of which exceeded in cost the Manhattan Project that produced the A-bomb.
programme.desc: There have been a catalogue of inventions in the history of warfare that have changed the way battles are fought, but one weapon changed not only the battlefield, but war itself: the bomber.

programme.title: The Giza Pyramid: Reaching For The Stars
programme.desc: The world is fascinated by the Pyramids of Giza; we explore theories and recent advances in archaeology, Egyptology and astrophysics to decipher the clues left behind by the ancient Egyptians.

programme.title: Secret Lives of the Roman Emperors with Mary Beard
programme.desc: Acclaimed classicist Mary Beard explores what it was really like to be emperor of Rome, taking us behind palace walls to reveal the hidden world of the Roman imperial court and lifestyle.

programme.title: Crucifixion Bones
programme.desc: In 2017, an ordinary archaeological dig in the Cambridgeshire Fens turns up a sensational discovery when the best-preserved example of a Roman crucifixion ever discovered is unearthed.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: Part of the Nazi plan was to take control of most of Europes vast collection of artworks, treasures, and gold; the Nazis hid this massive loot down within mine shafts in Austria and Germany.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: Like the Kennedy dynasty in the US, the Agnelli story is marked by an over-sized influence on the history of their country and by a succession of tragedies that has spanned generations.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Secret Lives of the Roman Emperors with Mary Beard
programme.desc: Acclaimed classicist Mary Beard explores what it was really like to be emperor of Rome, taking us behind palace walls to reveal the hidden world of the Roman imperial court and lifestyle.

programme.title: Crucifixion Bones
programme.desc: In 2017, an ordinary archaeological dig in the Cambridgeshire Fens turns up a sensational discovery when the best-preserved example of a Roman crucifixion ever discovered is unearthed.

programme.title: The Mystery of the Holy Lance
programme.desc: The Holy Lance is said to be the weapon with which Roman legionary Longinus pierced Jesus Christs side after his crucifixion; this documentary explores the history of this captivating artefact.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: December 1944: with Europe in the grip of a terrible winter, Hitlers Panzers spearhead an attack on the Allied frontline in the Ardennes; they are to break through and re-capture the port of Antwerp.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: June-July 1944: three weeks after D-Day, the Allied advance has stalled; the killing fields around Hill 112 become the start of a brutal war of attrition that the Nazis cannot afford to wage.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: February 1945: a quarter of all US Marines who died in WWII were killed in Iwo Jima; the Leathernecks were forced to re-think their tactics as one in three of them became a casualty.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: April 1945: Stalins generals compete to raise the Red Flag over the Reichstag; a Panzer Army, two army groups, and the home guard are locked in a desperate battle with the encircling Red Army.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: Deception WWII
programme.sub-title: WWII began with a deadly deception inside a Polish radio station; the early years of the war saw deception in its infancy, from code-breaking and spies to fake bombing sites and even inflatable tanks.
programme.desc: Tracking six years of conflict, this series picks apart various wartime operations and looks at the men and women who managed to fool entire governments and armies.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: June 1944: the British and Canadians are still short of the objective they planned to capture on D-Day: the city of Caen. This episode tells the story of the bloody fighting for the city.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: July 1944: American forces plan a major offensive named Operation Cobra. They would attack near St Lo, achieve a breakthrough, then unleash General Patton and the US Third Army to exploit the opening.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: September 1944: Montgomery proposes a bold plan to cross the Rhine and encircle Germanys industrial heartland. If successful, his plan could end the war by Christmas.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: October 1944: the Allies face a major supply crisis - vital fuel and ammunition still has to be landed at the D-Day beaches. When the port of Antwerp is liberated, it seems the crisis might be over.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: November 1944: as the Allies advance into Germany, they run into concrete bunkers, pillboxes, minefields and tank traps. German soldiers fight tenaciously to defend their homeland.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: No Asylum: The Untold Chapter of Anne Franks Story
programme.desc: Newly-discovered letters of Anne Franks father Otto and interviews with their family reveal his struggle to save their family for the first time.

programme.title: Women Under Hitlers Flag
programme.sub-title: This first episode, which begins with Hitlers arrival in power in 1933, goes back to the roots of the indoctrination of young German girls within the female branch of the Hitler Youth (BDM).
programme.desc: Many German women were active participants in the Nazi regime, some proving to be as ruthless as their better-known male counterparts; why did post-war justice turn a blind eye to their crimes?

programme.title: Why Planes Vanish: The Mystery of Flight MH370
programme.desc: Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 disappeared with 239 passengers and crew on board on the 8th of March, 2014; this documentary looks at if new radio technology could help locate the missing aircraft.

programme.title: Women Under Hitlers Flag
programme.sub-title: This first episode, which begins with Hitlers arrival in power in 1933, goes back to the roots of the indoctrination of young German girls within the female branch of the Hitler Youth (BDM).
programme.desc: Many German women were active participants in the Nazi regime, some proving to be as ruthless as their better-known male counterparts; why did post-war justice turn a blind eye to their crimes?

programme.title: Women Under Hitlers Flag

programme.desc: Many German women were active participants in the Nazi regime, some proving to be as ruthless as their better-known male counterparts; why did post-war justice turn a blind eye to their crimes?

programme.title: No Asylum: The Untold Chapter of Anne Franks Story
programme.desc: Newly-discovered letters of Anne Franks father Otto and interviews with their family reveal his struggle to save their family for the first time.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: The Habsburgs were the most powerful family in Europe for centuries; why was their destiny so fatal, and were all their tribulations connected to some kind of curse?
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: The story of how Persia morphed into Iran is very much the story of one family, the Pahlavis. Their reign would prove short-lived for a dynasty, but it was the most tumultuous in the nations history.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Treasures with Bettany Hughes
programme.sub-title: Bettany travels into the eastern Mediterranean to explore the countries around the Levantine Sea as we learn more about the regions rich history, its people and its cultural significance.
programme.desc: Professor Bettany Hughes travels across the world to investigate the story of humanity; making new discoveries along the way, she lifts the lid on the most remarkable treasures of civilisation.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Great Pyramid at Giza in Egypt is a wonder of the world, but when was it built, for what purpose, and by who, and what can the earliest pyramid of Djoser at Saqqara add to the argument?
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: The Mystery of the Holy Lance
programme.desc: The Holy Lance is said to be the weapon with which Roman legionary Longinus pierced Jesus Christs side after his crucifixion; this documentary explores the history of this captivating artefact.

programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Queens That Changed The World
programme.sub-title: Eleanor became Queen of France whilst still a teenager; after that marriage was annulled, she married English heir Henry and had a strong influence on both the kings and her sons reigns.
programme.desc: For so long believed to be side characters in histories dominated by men, some queens wielded extraordinary power; we discover how six women ruled in ways that far surpassed their male counterparts.

programme.title: Queens That Changed The World
programme.sub-title: Boudicas husband Prasutagus, who was chief of the Iceni, died before Roman invaders beat her and had her daughters raped; in revenge, Boudica and her army razed Roman cities to the ground.
programme.desc: For so long believed to be side characters in histories dominated by men, some queens wielded extraordinary power; we discover how six women ruled in ways that far surpassed their male counterparts.

programme.title: The True Story of the Tattooist of Auschwitz
programme.desc: Lali and Gita Sokolovs story stands as a powerful tribute to human endurance; this documentary sheds light on their incredible love story while revisiting the horrors of Auschwitz and the Holocaust.

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: The scars of centuries of conflict are etched into Italys ancient landmarks; this episode explores how it rose from the devastating failure of fascism to the rebirth of its identity.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: Roman Megastructures
programme.sub-title: Lyon is the third-largest city in France; in ancient times it was the largest. At the time, the capital of the Gauls was called Lugdunum, a showcase for Rome in lands conquered by Julius Caesar.
programme.desc: We explore three cities that were once part of Julius Caesars quest to grow the Roman Empire; through the use of CGI and expert testimony, we unveil the secrets of these wonders of Roman engineering.

programme.title: Roman Megastructures
programme.sub-title: During the Gallic Wars, Arles in the south of France fared really well. The most beautiful Roman monuments were built there, hence Arles was nicknamed the little Rome of Ancient Gaul.
programme.desc: We explore three cities that were once part of Julius Caesars quest to grow the Roman Empire; through the use of CGI and expert testimony, we unveil the secrets of these wonders of Roman engineering.

programme.title: Roman Megastructures
programme.sub-title: Using 3D imagery, reconstitutions and interviews with historians and archaeologists, this episode tells the story of Gallo-Roman Paris and uncovers the vestiges of ancient Paris: Lutetia.
programme.desc: We explore three cities that were once part of Julius Caesars quest to grow the Roman Empire; through the use of CGI and expert testimony, we unveil the secrets of these wonders of Roman engineering.

programme.title: Secret Lives of the Roman Emperors with Mary Beard
programme.desc: Acclaimed classicist Mary Beard explores what it was really like to be emperor of Rome, taking us behind palace walls to reveal the hidden world of the Roman imperial court and lifestyle.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: This episode explores moments of the war where Allied forces started to push back: the relief of Leningrad, the liberation of Paris, D-Day and the liberation of the Nazi extermination camps.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: We witness the final moments and aftermath of World War II with the establishment of war crime trials - such as the ones in Nuremberg - and move towards peace with the creation of the United Nations.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: In June 1914, the first steps towards war were made when Archduke Franz Ferdinand, from the house of Habsburg, was assassinated by Slav nationalist Gavrilo Princip.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: During WWI, men had to endure combat and extreme conditions; civilians dealt with food shortages and raids. The insidiousness of ethnic cleansing raised its head, and a young Adolf Hitler took note.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: Stalin rises as the leader of the Bolsheviks, and in Munich, the German Workers Party takes a new name: Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter, or Nazi as it would come to be called.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: Waco: Untold Stories
programme.sub-title: In 1993, 82 members of a religious sect called the Branch Davidians died due to a fire and an infamous 51-day siege by the FBI; many of these were British, and these are their stories.
programme.desc: In 1993, 82 members of an extremist religious group called the Branch Davidians lost their lives in one of the most controversial sieges in modern American history.

programme.title: Waco: Untold Stories
programme.sub-title: The concluding episode of the series. As operations to enforce the law on the Branch Davidians begin, the siege ends with the deaths of men, women and children in a fire.
programme.desc: In 1993, 82 members of an extremist religious group called the Branch Davidians lost their lives in one of the most controversial sieges in modern American history.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: This episode focuses on Guernsey, an island which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: Hitler and Stalin begin to shape the course of history. President Roosevelt attempts to raise his country out of the Depression, and the world teeters on the brink of yet another World War.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: December 1944: Hitler has picked the Ardennes sector for a major offensive. The surprise attack, spearheaded by elite divisions, initially sends American units reeling.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: France faced a tumultuous journey during and after WWII; this episode captures Frances struggle, resilience and rebirth and shows how architecture became a powerful symbol of recovery and renewal.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: Bomber: Terror of WWII
programme.sub-title: The last months of WWII saw the appearance of what Hitler believed to be the wonder weapons that would turn a lost cause into victory: cruise missiles (the V1) and ballistic missiles (the V2).
programme.desc: There have been a catalogue of inventions in the history of warfare that have changed the way battles are fought, but one weapon changed not only the battlefield, but war itself: the bomber.

programme.title: Robotmonstrumid
programme.desc: Meditsiinitudengid satuvad tunnistajateks ebaõnnestunud võitlusrobotite katsetustele. Robotid tapavad Kambodža kulakese elanikud. Operatsiooni eest vastutavad CIA juhid ei kavatse jatta tunnistajaid.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Dr Amanda tries to collar a roan antelope, the team chases down blue monkey Indigo while unrest ensues among the vervets, and we examine an eagle owl with bumblefoot and say adieu to Sheila the croc.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Ed and Dunc set out on a shark mission in Shark Bay to restock Ocean Park after having closed for Covid, and Rick weighs a Rottweiler using his local pubs forklift.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The heart of the South American continent is the Amazon jungle, the largest woodland on the planet; witness the planets largest eagle, the monkey-hunting harpy, pink dolphins and the giant otter.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian is called to an emergency on Tom Stockils farm and Peter removes an ominous looking lump for boxer dog Boot; this brings back bittersweet memories for Peter of his own beloved boxer Alf.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: A special episode focusing on births and babies; Julian heads to a local farm where a cow is struggling in labour, and baby goat Daisy has serious eye problems that are affecting her sight.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet

programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian races to an emergency at a local farm where a cow is unable to stand up, and Peter tries to save three-week-old Sphynx kitten Dobby; his tiny patient has pneumonia.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy embarks on his most horrific case yet: a man having his face ripped off in a remote Bolivian river. This journey ends up challenging his core beliefs about one of his oldest adversaries.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Ice Age: A Frozen World
programme.sub-title: Steve Backshall and Michaela Strachan witness the rise of mega beasts like the woolly mammoth and sabretooth cat; we reveal how these mighty creatures survived such savage environmental extremes.
programme.desc: Naturalist and explorer Steve Backshall - and wildlife presenter Michaela Strachan - take us on a gripping journey into the heart of the Ice Age.

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: The three-horned Triceratops is one of the most famous of all dinosaurs and often depicted locked in combat with a notorious predator: T-Rex. Did these two prehistoric titans really fight each other?
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: The woolly rhino once roamed northern Europe - now new discoveries from inside a cave in southern England reveal what really killed this Ice Age beast.
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Animal Odyssey
programme.sub-title: Today, the grizzly bear is a star in Yellowstone National Park. But the history of the bear is rooted in that of a large family of mammals: the carnivores, which appeared 60 million years ago.
programme.desc: Where, when, and how did the species we know appear? Today, science has unravelled the great journeys of the species, allowing us to tell the amazing story of animal colonisation.

programme.title: Shark
programme.sub-title: Fatal shark attacks doubled in 2023; we explore the man-eating predators behind these shocking figures and meet near-death survivors who have come within inches of being eaten.
programme.desc: With the help of local shark hunters and tracking experts, a thrilling three-day expedition embarks on a quest to chase some of the biggest sharks on the planet.

programme.title: Planet Shark
programme.sub-title: Sharks have evolved to take advantage of every feeding opportunity in the ocean; from aerial acrobats to camouflaged ambush killers, how have these apex predators become so successful?
programme.desc: Sharks are one of the oldest and successful hunters ever to have lived; they dominate every corner of our oceans, but what is it about these extraordinary survivors that makes them so successful?

programme.title: Save This Shark
programme.desc: Surf champion and wildlife conservationist Mick Fanning teams up with leading experts to uncover the hidden truths about sharks, threats, and how to save them from extinction.

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.sub-title: Cold hearts beat with a raging hot fury in a frozen world of snow, icy waters and extreme wind chill; from snow leopards to polar bears, these fighters battle it out with each other.
programme.desc: We show how animals use their unique attributes to defeat their opponents; they have honed their skills for millennia and have become masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Return to South Luangwa to see the new pups born to the mighty Manzi, the tiny-but-fearless Kakumbi packs, and yearling Snowy face a hungry hyena before a lion pride scatters Manzi mum Wekas pups.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Run into a lion-hyena showdown with Julz as he hunts for the elusive Manzi pack and join Henry from the Zambian Carnivore Program on a house call to the Kakumbi den where another pup has gone missing.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.sub-title: Julz and Henry from the ZCP track the Kakumbi pups as they face off with a warthog, and Thandie Mweetwa - ZCPs lion specialist - counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride

programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Head back to the den with the Kakumbi - who are mourning the loss of two pups - and chance upon a hyena lair and a lion pride trying to take down a buffalo.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt arrives in eastern Zambia to film three packs of wild dogs - the Manzis, Kakulis and Stork Colony - in three very different territories.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its 100 degrees and rising; as waterholes dry up, Julz is alarmed to find lions in the Kakuli packs favourite drinking spot but also gets to touch a wild dog for the first time ever.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: Hunger drives the cubs to violence and family relationships are complicated; the lions rely on the more agile lionesses for hunting and face challenges such as climate change.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: Pride of India
programme.desc: Gujarat in India is home to the last Asiatic lions in the wild; a first-time mother lioness must be creative in her survival skills to raise a new king, and that includes fooling the old one.

programme.title: In Search of Snow Leopards: Chasing Shadows
programme.desc: We reveal the fascinating life of the snow leopards - the most secretive and least understood of all the great cats - as they are filmed in Spiti Valley in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh.

programme.title: In Search of Snow Leopards: Chasing Shadows
programme.desc: We reveal the fascinating life of the snow leopards - the most secretive and least understood of all the great cats - as they are filmed in Spiti Valley in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh.

programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Julz and Henry from the ZCP track the Kakumbi pups as they face off with a warthog, and Thandie Mweetwa - ZCPs lion specialist - counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz on a ZCP lion-collaring mission, go fishing with scout Simon, study mealtime pack hierarchy and witness a heartbreaking vigil for a badly-injured Kakumbi pup.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Head back to the den with the Kakumbi - who are mourning the loss of two pups - and chance upon a hyena lair and a lion pride trying to take down a buffalo.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt arrives in eastern Zambia to film three packs of wild dogs - the Manzis, Kakulis and Stork Colony - in three very different territories.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its 100 degrees and rising; as waterholes dry up, Julz is alarmed to find lions in the Kakuli packs favourite drinking spot but also gets to touch a wild dog for the first time ever.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Pride of India
programme.desc: Gujarat in India is home to the last Asiatic lions in the wild; a first-time mother lioness must be creative in her survival skills to raise a new king, and that includes fooling the old one.

programme.title: Patagonia: Earths Secret Paradise
programme.sub-title: This is the story of a coastline 4,000 miles long from Cape Horn - where rockhopper penguins raise their young - to the north where huge elephant seals battle for position in the heat of the desert.
programme.desc: This three-part series discovers the surprising stories of the unusual wildlife and the people that survive in epic Patagonian landscapes of volcanoes, glaciers, desert and treacherous oceans.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Summer is the season of extremes, but things arent as simple as hot and cold; the top of the planet is in 24 hours of sunlight by June while the bottom is frozen in darkness.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Autumn is the season of change; change brings opportunity for many but also huge challenges. Time is running out and preparedness is key as the year draws to a close and winter returns.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: Shark
programme.sub-title: Fatal shark attacks doubled in 2023; we explore the man-eating predators behind these shocking figures and meet near-death survivors who have come within inches of being eaten.
programme.desc: With the help of local shark hunters and tracking experts, a thrilling three-day expedition embarks on a quest to chase some of the biggest sharks on the planet.

programme.title: Planet Shark
programme.sub-title: Sharks have evolved to take advantage of every feeding opportunity in the ocean; from aerial acrobats to camouflaged ambush killers, how have these apex predators become so successful?
programme.desc: Sharks are one of the oldest and successful hunters ever to have lived; they dominate every corner of our oceans, but what is it about these extraordinary survivors that makes them so successful?

programme.title: Save This Shark
programme.desc: Surf champion and wildlife conservationist Mick Fanning teams up with leading experts to uncover the hidden truths about sharks, threats, and how to save them from extinction.

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.sub-title: Cold hearts beat with a raging hot fury in a frozen world of snow, icy waters and extreme wind chill; from snow leopards to polar bears, these fighters battle it out with each other.
programme.desc: We show how animals use their unique attributes to defeat their opponents; they have honed their skills for millennia and have become masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Pride of India
programme.desc: Gujarat in India is home to the last Asiatic lions in the wild; a first-time mother lioness must be creative in her survival skills to raise a new king, and that includes fooling the old one.

programme.title: Wild Sri Lanka: Realm of the Leopard
programme.desc: This film looks at Sri Lankas wildlife; leopards, jackals and crocodiles are the apex predators, but it also boasts some of the rarest creatures on Earth, including the sloth bear and the grey loris.

programme.title: Hidden India
programme.sub-title: India is a land of seasonal extremes; monsoon rains flood the land, and heat and drought builds once they are gone. Its a challenge for the animals, but it also fosters amazing landscapes.
programme.desc: We celebrate the diversity and flavours of the Indian subcontinent, travelling from the roof of the world in the north to the great rivers and deserts at its heart and the rainforests of the south.

programme.title: Secrets of the Enchanted Forests
programme.sub-title: Climb into a realm of thin air and towering rock; tag along as mythical monkeys battle for a winter food stash, and sing along with lemurs in a fruit-filled tree canopy.
programme.desc: Traverse the planets richest and most diverse woodlands - from the tropics to the poles and everywhere in between - and learn how forests connect and nurture the lives of countless species.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: An elephant is brought into AandE with a suspected deadly herpes virus, Kat treats the infected foot of a female elephant, and we visit the largest herd in the hospital swimming in the river.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Katy treats a Staffie with a deadly disease, a Great Dane rescues a dog needing a blood transfusion, and Rick and zoologist Ed Swinhoe test a wild dingos DNA in the outback near Exmouth.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The Caribbean Sea is a mythical place with a wild jungle world living on its shores; this region is home to the axolotls, the Montezuma oropendola, dozens of species of tree frogs, and pit vipers.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Bull Pip needs an urgent foot trim, but hes reluctant to lie down and allow Peter do his job; in Boroughbridge, Julian and Katy are operating on Berties the beagles leg.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Amadeus the alpaca has a stick in his eye which has caused a nasty injury, and Peter greets a familiar face from Down Under when a baby wallaby comes to the practice a little down in the dumps.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt arrives in eastern Zambia to film three packs of wild dogs - the Manzis, Kakulis and Stork Colony - in three very different territories.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.
